quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: College and Wrestler
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, john, rookie. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Where did New Jersey Net guard Jason Kidd go to college?
Hulk Hogan had two title defences on Saturday Nights Main Event in 1985. Which of the listed wrestlers was one of his opponents?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cowboy Bob Orton

questions.question: What was the name of the minor league baseball team, featured in the 1987 movie Long Gone starring William L. Peterson?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tampico Stogies

questions.question: Who was the winner of the WWF champion vs. the NWA champion match in 1980?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bob Backlund

questions.question: Cowboy Bob Orton wrestled at the first Starrcade, and won.
What former professional wrestler won the 1986 Slammy Award for Best Male Performance?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Junk Yard Dog

questions.question: Who was the first King of the Ring?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Don Murraco

questions.question: Brad Miller of the Sacramento Kings played basketball at what Big Ten University?
NBA player Eddie Jones played college basketball at what school?
Danny Granger played basketball at what college?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New Mexico

questions.question: Quentin Richardson, who signed with the New York Knicks in 2005, played college basketball at what school?
Big John Studd wrestled for Fritz Von Erichs World Class promotion under which identity?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Captain USA

questions.question: In 1979, this wrestler won the PWI Rookie of the year award, by the name of Sweet Brown Sugar. He went on to lose all three of his Wrestlemania appearances, and was a mid-carder at best in the WWF.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Koko B. Ware

questions.question: Jason Williams, nicknamed White Chocolate, played college basketball at the University of Florida in 1998. What school did Williams play for before he transferred to Florida?

Which wrestler, winner of the PWI awards for most popular wrestler of the year, and most hated wrestler of the year, was also the first runner-up for the most inspirational wrestler of the year award in 1983?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roddy Piper

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Nickname and Team
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, nickname, atlanta. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who was the head coach at Florida State, who preceded Bobby Bowden?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Darrell Mudra

questions.question: Charles Woodson, who won the Heisman trophy in 1997, played in what position?
The movie Eight Men Out depicts the scandal that followed after several Chicago White Sox players allegedly accepted money to play poorly in the 1919 World Series against the New York Giants.
The Rose Bowl is an annual American college football game, usually played on January 1.
In the film Mr. Baseball, Tom Selleck portrays an aging New York Yankees player who is traded to what Japanese baseball team?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nagoya Chunichi Dragons

questions.question: This man, who was head coach at The Ohio State University for 28 years, delivered the following words: There was no one who had better people than I did, or better football players. And, we outworked the other teams.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Woody Hayes

questions.question: From 1962-1968, this baseball team was known by the nickname, The Lovable Losers, but in 1969 a miracle happened and they won the World Series.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Mets

questions.question: The Boston Red Sox are also known by the nickname The Old Town Team.
In what year did the the Southeastern Conference (SEC) receive permission from the NCAA to conduct an annual championship game in football?
Which of the following is the nickname of The Atlanta Braves?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Bravos

questions.question: Before becoming head coach of the University of Alabama football team, Paul Bear Bryant was head coach of three other university teams. Name the team which he did not coach.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Texas Tech

questions.question: Despite losing the 1950 World series in four straight games, this baseball team was nicknamed The Whiz Kids.
Americas Team is a commonly used nickname for the Dallas Cowboys.
What two teams played the first overtime game in the history of Division-I college football?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Toledo and Nevada

questions.question: This NHL team was nicknamed The Broad Street Bullies during their first ever winning season in 1973.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Philadelphia Flyers

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Catcher and Baseball
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, actor, yankees. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What year was the first Super Bowl played?
This football player turned actor appeared in four Rocky movies playing boxer Apollo Creed.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Carl Weathers

questions.question: Who was the first catcher to catch 4 no-hitters in his career?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ray Schalk

questions.question: Which of these statements about famous baseball catchers is incorrect?

options.text: Yogi Berra hit the first pinch hit home run in the World Series
Mike Piazza was the first catcher to hit 50 homers and 200 hits in a season
Clint Courtney was the first catcher to wear glasses
Clint Courtney was the first catcher to wear an oversized mitt

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mike Piazza was the first catcher to hit 50 homers and 200 hits in a season

questions.question: This player was the first catcher in the history of professional baseball to play close to the batter.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Charles Zimmer

questions.question: Which company was the first to start producing catchers mitts?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Draper and Maynard

questions.question: On June 28, 1907, this Yankees catcher was unable to throw out any of the 13 Washington Senators who stole second base.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Branch Rickey

questions.question: In 1914, this catcher broke the record for throwing out base runners in an inning.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Les Nunamaker

questions.question: In 1960, the New York Yankees set a record for having three catchers each of whom hit at least twenty home runs. Who were they?

options.text: Yogi Berra, Elston Howard, Thurmon Munson
Yogi Berra, Sammy White, Elston Howard
Yogi Berra, Elston Howard, Hank  Bauer
Yogi Berra, Elston Howard, Johnny Blanchard

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yogi Berra, Elston Howard, Johnny Blanchard

questions.question: In what year did baseball catchers first started using chest protectors?
Which of the following statements about the position of the catcher in baseball is true?

options.text: There is no limit on the maximum size for a catchers mitt.
The catcher is the only player in professional sports who is in foul territory before each play.
The catcher almost always bats last or next to last.
Every team is required to have at least three catchers on their roster.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The catcher is the only player in professional sports who is in foul territory before each play.

questions.question: When keeping a box score of a baseball game, what is the number of the catcher?
Which team won Super Bowl III in 1969?
Who was the first catcher to win both the Silver Slugger Award (Best Hitter at his position) and Golden Glove Award (Best fielder at his position) in the same year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ivan Rodriguez

questions.question: Who was the first catcher in the history of baseball to wear a mask?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fred Thayer, 1877

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Billiards and Team

questions.question: The San Francisco 49ers defeated the Denver Broncos 55–10 in Super Bowl XXIV.
The first references to indoor billiards date back to this century, when the game became especially fashionable among royalties.
Which team won Super Bowl XXXII?
Eight ball, a popular type of pool in United States and United Kingdom, is played with this number of balls (excluding the cue ball).
This team won their second consecutive Super Bowl on January 13th, 1974.
Billiards has been an Olympic sport since the 2004 Athens Olympic Games.
Pool, also known as pocket billiards, is the most popular variation of billiards in which country?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: United States

questions.question: The Chicago Bears won Super Bowl XX.
Which of these variations of the game of billiards uses the biggest playing tables?
Which team did the Dallas Cowboys beat to win Super Bowl XXX?

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The cue tip

questions.question: The Steelers won their fifth Super Bowl in Super Bowl XL.
The New England Patriots won Super Bowl XXXVI.
All variants of the game of billiards are played on a flat rectangular table with 6 pockets.
Which team was the first team to win four Super Bowls?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Billiards and Time
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, coaches, presidents. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Dick Butkus was a great middle linebacker for which team?
Terry Bradshaw was a quarterback for which of the following teams?
Andre Agassi won first position in singles rankings for the first time in his career in this year.
Which of these cities does not host any Tennis Masters Series tournaments?
In which New York area does the US Open take place?
At what time of the year is the US Open held?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: August / September

questions.question: Which of the Grand Slams has not been won by Pete Sampras?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roland Garros

questions.question: This tennis players nickname is Mr Boom Boom.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Boris Becker

questions.question: The other name of Queens Club Championship is this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stella Artois Championship

questions.question: Which of these distinguished American presidents home concealed a secret billiards room?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thomas Jefferson

questions.question: He was the first high-profile tennis player to be caught with a banned substance.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Petr Korda

questions.question: Nick Bollettieri is one of the most famous tennis coaches. Where is his training campus located?
For which of these teams did Troy Aikman play?
In the game of billiards, what situation does the term Double kiss refer to?

options.text: A shot intended to separate two closely clung balls
A shot pocketing two balls at the same time
A coloured ball rebounding in a rail and striking the cue ball that has just hit it
A shot with the cue ball being very closely clung to another ball

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A coloured ball rebounding in a rail and striking the cue ball that has just hit it

questions.question: World Confederation of Billiard Sports (WCBS), the international governing centre of billiards, snooker, and pool, is headquartered in what country?

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Iowa State

questions.question: What did the football teams of Syracuse, Alabama, and Penn State have in common in 1965?

options.text: They were the only unbeaten teams in Div I football
All three had the players number on their helmets
All three averaged more than 500 yds offense per game
All three had assistant coaches elevated to head coaches before midseason

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All three had the players number on their helmets

questions.question: What is the nickname of The Citadel, the Military College of South Carolina?

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: none of these
